intro: Argyrochosma fendleri, commonly known as the silverleaf stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and fleshy, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or white, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well-suited for arid and semi-arid environments. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
